headline: Periodontist, Dental Entrepreneur, DSO builder, and Coach.
about:
Periodontist, Marketing Diploma, MBA, CVA - Certified Valuation Analyst, Pilot, Traveler, and Triplets Dad. 

Partner at Community Dental Partners (82 dental practice locations), Co-founder of OrthoDent Mgmt (12 dental practice locations) and Modern Smiles (9 dental practice locations) and Owns Precision Advisory.

Tarek is a versatile professional who combines his background in General Dentistry and Periodontal surgery with a robust foundation in Management and Leadership. A graduate in Dentistry from Alexandria University in Egypt, he holds a graduate certificate in Periodontics & Oral Medicine from the same institution and a Diploma in Sales & Marketing from the American University in Cairo. Furthering his education, Tarek earned an MBA from Stephen F. Austin State University in Texas and obtained a CVA certification from the National Association of Certified Valuation Analysts.


With a wealth of experience, Tarek specializes in Dental Support Organizations platform development, Mergers and Acquisitions (M&As), Business Valuation, and Dental Organizations Management. He has authored three publications and is actively working on a book focusing on the management of dental practices and Dental Support Organizations (DSOs).


Tarek is deeply involved in the leadership and growth of various dental organizations. In addition to his roles in the dental field, he is a public speaker and an active participant in Toastmasters International.

experience.description:
• Install EmerALD, Pulsar, Synergis Atomic Layer Deposition equipment. Equipment:  EFEM, XP4, EmerALD, Pulsar module installation and build. Process: EmerALD, Pulsar Module setup, Susecptor Temperature setup and heating, Module recipes setup, Chamber Coating, Process runs.
• Troubleshoot EmerALD, Pulsar and Synergis chamber process issues; wafer uniformity, thickness, particles
• Troubleshoot Pulsar and EmerALD chamber equipment issues; handling (FE, BE), particles, pressure, replace i.e. MFC, Sources, Susceptors, chamber parts, align, EE, Computer Controllers, Software, Firmware Upgrades.
• Troubleshoot XP4, XP8 Module issues; Replace equipment parts i.e. EE, filters, MFC
• Install LPE Epitaxial Chamber LPE 208, Field Service Engineer Certified LPE 106A, LPE 108, SiC.
• Complete FrontEnd, BackEnd Robot, Aligner setup for LPE 106A, LPE 108.
• TMA install and setup LPE 108, including setting up TMA bubbler, gas line install and setup.

Senior Process engineer for facility technical transfer of line, Sensors and Specialist Components.
Improve Cleanroom equipment uptime and productivity. Cleanroom equipment include: Sputter deposition tools, Vacuum Anneal, Dry Etch Plasma Systems, Automated Wet Benches, Photoresist Aligners, Spin Coater and Develop Tracks. 
Improved product yields and product scraps solving handling, process issues and breakage issues.
Documenting for process steps, equipment, PM’s manufacturing processes, product travelers, and equipment qualifications. Improved factory processes and procedures to transfer the facility. Setup qualification procedures, material, and all metrology equipment to transfer the processes, and equipment for the startup.
Project Lead for new factory equipment layout design, installation, process readiness and release to production. Designed new equipment and facility layout to optimize quality, thru-put and costs. Worked with contractors on facility installs, and equipment installation to facilitate clean, cost effective, maintenance friendly setups. Developed equipment and process readiness qual plans, worked with process engineers to execute and complete plans through release to include frontend and backend equipment.

• Hired and trained shift personnel to produce the latest NANO technologies interconnects. Hired and trained operators within necessary window to meet growing demand. Developed new automated software control systems for monitoring product progress throughout product build. Created a standardization program aimed to better control contact height of nano devices, techniques and tooling with a 25% reduction in production time. Updated individual processes, improving process flows, tooling, techniques, and automation using Six Sigma Lean tools, with an 250% improvement in throughput, 100% reduction in reworks and defects, and a 10% cost reduction.

Transformation expertise through the deployment of process engineering, related tools and skillsets. Created and setup a hybrid processing engineering program. Developed the new program, completed documentation, process modeling, value stream mapping, implementation, framework for continuous improvement, and templates. Train and mentoring personnel to complete process engineering improvement through data collection using Tableau statistical software, troubleshooting, metrics/controls implementation, specification, and documentation.

experience.position: Final Assembly Process Manufacturing/Product/Systems Integration Engineer
experience.description:
• Direct Responsible Individual (DRI) Product/Process Engineer responsible for evaluating and implementing designs, fixtures, and processes for manufacturability to insure that product meets all quality, TAKT and delivery requirements. Responsible for production plans and continuous process improvements reducing cost of ownership by >$1000/unit built. Identified process improvements to obtain improved quality, yield improvements of >30%, reducing cycle time, and improving UPH (units per hour) by 100%. 
• Conduct and design well defined experiments and tests pertaining to the development of new algorithms, methods, processes, tooling, fixtures, hardware, ISO standards, modification of current material, components, software, process specifications and the resolution to complex technical problems. Develop solutions to design problems through the application of engineering principles, analysis, and empirical methods. Collect data, analyze results, generate reports, and provide recommendations with justifications relevant to product development.
• Manufacturing Execution System Integration/Automation Control - Developed, tested, implemented, and documented specifications for automated process control systems, PLC, HMI, and P&ID. Developed the systems, work with vendors on program development, test development and coordinated implementation of track and process equipment on the Final Assembly & Test line. Implemented system, created documentation, specifications, and trained maintenance personnel. Designed and implemented lift automation to reduce defects of >6% on track.

• Team Leader for a technology team which orchestrated new technology development, and the transfer of 45, 32, and 28nm nodes for 300mm wafers. Successfully led startup of more than 250 plasma etch equipment and operation processes including; transfer of process, equipment setup, sustaining methodologies, FMEA setup, equipment maintenance procedures, specifications, documentation, new products, identify any product/technology interactions using DFT(ATPG scans, JTAG, and speed testing), and manufacturing risk areas to create mitigation plans, continuous improvement and training. 
• Train and mentoring fellow engineers on setup methodologies in order to properly sustain the equipment, processes, specifications, and production control. List of techniques involved; statistical process control (SPC), continuous improvement plan (CIP), failure mode & effect analysis (FMEA), and issue resolution documentation (8D). 
• Project Leader for a team tasked to solve a lifting metal gate issue. Using experience, data analysis, and experimentation found it to be a pre-clean prior to polysilicon deposition leaving a residue on the surface of the wafer affecting adhesion of the polysilicon material to the high-k dielectric. Final resolution was to change the equipment configuration differences found during an equipment audit. The yield loss was >30% equaling >75 die per wafer. The loss in revenue was $5500 per wafer, and >30,000 wafers shipped per month. 
• Process innovation solving a small defect issue resulting in a die loss of >5%. The issue was resolved using experiments to analyze defect data, versus slot/equipment order. Final resolution was traced to de-conditioning of the equipment by incorrect automation setup. Collaborated with automation software developers to correct modeling and equipment automation setup. Developed a new model, system setup, testing, specifications, and documentation resulting in elimination of the die loss.

• Completed process technology development, transfer, and new product startup, i.e.; process development, transfer, plasma etch equipment installation, equipment maintenance, development, troubleshooting, training, product introduction, startup, setup sustaining methodologies, and documentation to full ramp manufacturing. 
• Lead cross functional teams comprised of functional area engineers, product engineering, process integration, and yield engineers. The team was in charge of 60, 45, 32, 28nm new technology and product introductions to identify any product/technology interactions and manufacturing risk areas and create mitigation plans. 
• Contributed to development and implementation of the Dynamic Transistor Critical Dimension Reduction through Project Leadership, and Model development. Implementation resulting in automated processing of the material on the equipment without any manual intervention and kept the transistor to transistor matching to a higher level and resulted in improved revenue of >$20 million per quarter. 
• Project leader for development of a manufacturing execution system (MES) control system for a Remote Operational Command center to run material through the Fabrication units. Created automated Fab material handling requiring no manufacturing in the Fab and allows for a reduction in manufacturing personnel headcount by 50% per factory. 
• Team Leader to resolve yield loss caused by queue time. The lack of deposition material on the transistor versus time caused an increase in resistance, slowing microprocessor performance and increased the power usage resulting in a loss of 6-7%, 20-25 die, at $300 per die loss in income. Using data analysis confirmed queue time effect on resistance increase and developed a solution. 
• Project Leader, find the solution to a 20% decrease in defects per wafer and lost revenue of >$4.5M per week.

Led a team to Solve an AlCu corrosion issue responsible for a >30% Die loss. Using Troubleshooting techniques the root cause was found, developed a solution, and then implemented processes and procedures to prevent future corrosion. This also led to the improvement of tool availability by process characterization and optimization of the etch and strip modules. 

Worked with Lam Research a vendor to develop the internal part, implement processes, and then co-authored a paper with LAM Research on the ESC Chuck for the plasma etchers. This resulted in a >10% improvement in die yield over the use of traditional mechanical clamp system for holding the wafers in place during backside He cooling of the wafer.

R&D Technician - Compound Semiconductor lab, responsible for building RIE, RIBE etch systems, maintenance and process development

publications.title: 2005 - IEEE Transactions on Semiconductor Manufacturing, Vol. 18, No. 4, November 2005, Improvements in PolySilicon Etch  Bias and Transistor Gate Control with Module Level APC Methodologies.
publications.description: The targeting of transistor gate length is a primary driver of device performance. The targeting of the physical gate critical dimension (CD) greatly impacts the electrical gate dimension. Traditionally, continual monitoring and manual offsets to compensate for lithographic and etch equipment variability have been used to control gate CDs. The paper discusses how advanced process control techniques were applied to the 0.13micron polysilicon patterning process. Both scanner and etch equipment were controlled using a combination of feedfoward and feedback loops. As a result, significant engineering labor was saved, and gate CD 3 sigma results improved 12%, correlating to improved device performance and enhanced yield.

experience.position: Director On-Site Technology Support (North & Latin America)
experience.description:
As a Director of Onsite Technology Support, I manage and collaborate with my team in delivering world-class IT support for North & Latin America enterprise employees. Our focus is on proactive and predictive solutions that prevent technology issues before they escalate, ensuring efficient, seamless, omni-channel support across platforms. By leveraging AI, automation, and shift-left strategies, we drive efficiency, reduce recurring issues, and champion user independence through self-service solutions. Additionally, we optimize service management by integrating adaptive IT healing technologies and continuous process improvements. 

My immediate goal upon joining the Visa Technology team is to learn from and contribute to this high-performing group as we work together to elevate IT digital support and ultimately enhance the customer experience across the Visa organization.

Led technology services for the public safety industry, including facility field services, CCTV security engineering, AI camera configurations, and ITAM management. Ensured technology support services achieved operational goals including enhancing the digital experience (DEX) for all employees and end-users.

Accountable for budgets, financial forecasting, vendor management, and driving business deliverables with operational objectives.  

Focused on mentoring and developing a high-quality, adaptable technology services team.

Managed a high-performing technology services organization, overseeing end-to-end workplace and executive support services across North America. Led a team of over 120 employees, contractors, and third-party vendors, delivering on-site services, executive support, remote tech support, mobility solutions, IT asset management (ITAM), and enterprise-wide software and AV adoption across 200 multi-functional sites, supporting over 30,000 international users.

Oversaw all aspects of technical support, including incident management, SLA adherence, and performance metrics to ensure seamless operations and high-quality service delivery. Defined and executed digital transformation initiatives to optimize operations, integrate emerging technologies, and enhance service delivery. Utilized Active Directory for user management, SailPoint for identity governance, and BMC Remedy and ServiceNow for ticketing, incident tracking, and service request fulfillment. 

Provided comprehensive support for AV systems and virtual meeting platforms and developed a 3-week technical partner training program, resulting in improved knowledge transfer and higher satisfaction scores for on-site support. Proficient in deploying IoT solutions and leveraging ITIL and ITSM frameworks; Agile including sAFe, and Lean Six Sigma frameworks to drive operational efficiency, compliance, and organizational excellence, while fostering a culture of respect, accountability, and continuous employee development.

1995-2005; 2012-2019. Accomplished IT leader 15+ years driving DevOps and ERP transformations across diverse industries. Specializes in SAP® Financial and integration solutions, including greenfield and brownfield S/4HANA cloud implementations. 

End-to-end project management expertise, including resource allocation, risk management, budget and timeline adherence, performance metrics, release management, continuous improvement, data governance, and data analytics. Ability to lead large, globally distributed, and culturally diverse teams, fostering collaboration and ensuring alignment with organizational goals. 

Skilled in stakeholder management and talent development, identifying key capabilities of diverse early, mid and senior-career talent. Leveraged Waterfall and Agile methodologies to optimize SDLC efficiency and employed ITIL for service delivery and operational efficiency.

Committed to maintaining compliance frameworks and delivering high quality SAP solutions. Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, facilitating workshops, and building strong stakeholder relationships. Experienced with Agile, Scrum and Kanban; and Atlassian Confluence and JIRA. Adept at financial oversight, data governance, best practices, and optimizing processes through analytics for strategic decision-making across various industries.

Led complex cross-functional enterprise system architecture (ESA) projects for multi-billion-dollar organizations, overseeing full SAP FI/CO implementations. Delivered solutions aligning with clients' financial and operational goals while managing global teams of consultants and developers.

Key achievements include enhancing financial processes, improving reporting accuracy, and ensuring data governance across industries like oil & gas, high-tech electronics, energy management, digital automation and hosting, manufacturing, agriscience, chemicals, and automotive.

projects.title: Tech Partner Professional Training Program
projects.description: Building the Tech Partner Professional Training Program was a dynamic initiative that transformed the way we delivered IT services across North America. It began with strategic planning, interviewing, and hiring 12 high-potential individuals to create a customer-facing, user-centric team focused on end-user IT support across distributed business sites. The program focused on not just technical proficiency but also the development of critical soft skills like professional presence, communication, time-management, scope boundaries, and fostering team camaraderie. Through structured in-person training sessions and cross-training opportunities, the team learned to establish stakeholder relationships, integrate into manufacturing and research environments, and represent elevated professional standards. Team and individual accountability measurements and best practices were implemented, ensuring consistent service delivery within key stakeholder communities. The result was a strongly grounded, adaptable team that became a model of technical service delivery which enhanced the employee experience across the region.

projects.title: AI Camera Tech Innovation Implementation
projects.description:
Implementation of cutting-edge AI-driven CCTV security cameras for surveillance capabilities. The project involved deploying over 350 advanced network IP cameras, equipped with integrated video analytics software to enable AI-powered features. AI functionalities include vehicle detection, person detection, people counting, and sensitive area monitoring. 

The deployment also encompassed defining and implementing the integration of the supporting network infrastructure, ensuring seamless connectivity and viable system reliability.

The end-point devices utilized a configured AI layer to process raw video footage, apply advanced logic-based rules and reference-based images to trigger intelligent actions. This innovation enabled proactive security monitoring, real-time notifications, and enhanced situational awareness.

Stanford Executive education (LEAD Program) from Stanford Graduate School of Business:
Stanford LEAD is a 9-course program which develops effective
leaders who embody five core leadership competencies: critical analysis,
self-awareness, interpersonal acumen, situational awareness, and holistic
communication. These leaders complete coursework in key business fundamentals:
finance, strategy, and critical analytical thinking, as well as elective coursework which
equips them to successfully address and navigate the challenges and opportunities
inherent in fostering and implementing change within their organizations. Throughout
the program, participants exchange ideas and collaborate on projects with small
teams of like-minded, like-motivated peers, and engage with world-renowned
Stanford GSB faculty, Silicon Valley leaders, coaches, thought leaders, and luminaries
through regular live events, discussions, and facilitated feedback.

headline: Sales Strategist & Transformation Expert | Driving Revenue Growth & Team Excellence in SaaS
about:
I’m passionate about building teams and cultures where people feel valued, empowered, and set up for success. There’s nothing more rewarding than seeing a team come together, gain clarity on their goals, and build momentum that carries them forward.

Throughout my career, I’ve focused on bringing structure to fast-moving environments—helping teams find the right balance between process and adaptability. Scaling a team isn’t just about hitting numbers; it’s about setting a foundation that allows people to thrive and do their best work. By focusing on the right mix of people, processes, and tools, I’ve helped organizations grow in a way that’s both impactful and sustainable.

For me, success comes down to clear communication, trust, and a shared commitment to something bigger than any one person. I’m driven by the opportunity to help people and businesses unlock their potential, and I believe the best results come when everyone feels connected to the bigger picture.
topSkills: Building World Class Teams • Organizational Design • Strategic Thinking • Team Motivation • Sales Leadership

experience.description:
Scaling sales without the buzzwords or the burnout.

I work with companies that need to build or rebuild their sales teams the right way. The most common challenges I see are leads getting stuck, processes that are all over the place, and teams not set up to win. I help clean it up, get everyone aligned, and create a structure that supports real growth. 

No overcomplicating it, just focusing on what matters and making sure the team has what they need to succeed.

Through strategic collaboration with channel partners, we achieved a significant 52% increase in Q2 2022 revenue. Leveraging our partner ecosystem for co-selling initiatives in the Energy and Financial Services sectors, we successfully expanded our reach and drove impressive growth. The implementation of the Value Selling methodology further contributed to our overall success.

During my tenure at ClearDATA, I successfully built/scaled the sales team, driving net new business growth and increasing revenue from $5M to over $16M. I recruited and mentored strategic account executives, focusing on healthcare, health-tech, payer, provider, and life sciences sectors. By implementing growth strategies, we achieved a remarkable 320% increase in revenue. Through account-based selling, we doubled new logos, and a collaborative program I initiated with the co-founder led to additional growth. Additionally, I revamped the BDR team, fostering career development and nurturing promising sales talent.

As the leader of the Business Development Organization, I successfully achieved annual and strategic pipeline targets of $350M through strategic restructuring and reorganization efforts. By streamlining operations, implementing new methodologies and tools, and developing quarterly business plans, our lean and agile team consistently exceeded our goals. Collaborating closely with other departments, including Product Marketing, Digital Marketing, and Regional Marketing, we optimized the inbound lead process and maximized the effectiveness of our content. Our team's strong contribution to the overall revenue achievement helped the company to grow and scale in a highly competitive market.

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: February 18, 2023, Jason worked with Matt but they were at different companies
receivedRecommendations.description:
I first met Matt while interviewing at Informatica for an open sales role. Immediately I was impressed with Matt as most Directors that interview IC roles never seemed as genuine as Matt did.  That day Matt took me on a tour, showed me around and spoke to the vision and goals of the executive team. I left that day thinking if I don’t get the role, at the very least my network just picked up a heavy hitter. Fast forward 7 years, Matt reached out to me via LinkedIn.  We travel in the same circle of groups, people and of course tech news. We would see each other in the “hallways” but never crossed paths until he reached out just to let me know that he was available if I needed anything as I just was laid off. Long story short, I took him up on that offer and asked for some guidance. Not only did Matt go out of his way to lend an ear but he called and proceeded to share what you would consider an consultant’s brief. When a totally stranger interrupts your day, has an ask that is selfishly one sided and needs your response within 3 hours, most of us would not take the time to accommodate.  Matt is not like that, he leads when no one is watching, he mentors when there is no monetary benefit and he supports with out the need for praise, acknowledgment or FB posts. The man is a cold stone professional and someone who at the end of the day is authentic! 

To top all of the personal integrity he shows, and the emotional strength, he is a master in his field: 

- Consultive Problem Solving 
- Networking
- Data Governance
- Business Development
- Leadership 
- Mentoring 

Just to name a few. I highly recommend that you stop, grab a cup of coffee with Matt.  If you do, you will walk away better and unknowingly will have gained a friend and human that is going to show up 100% daily!

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: October 31, 2022, Eric worked with Matt but on different teams
receivedRecommendations.description: As someone that works in Market & Competitive Intelligence, a common observation is that some of the most successful sellers are those that use our services the most. At times these colleagues can be demanding, but you understand that supporting these folks is valuable because they are good at what they do. Matt was one of the most collaborative and resourceful Sales team members that I worked with during our time at Collibra. On top of that, it was evident that Matt genuinely cared about his team and was driven by their collective success. These are traits that shouldn't be taken for granted, and will serve him well for years to come.

headline: Chief Technology Officer at D3Clarity, Inc. | Podcast Host | Cloud and Data Expert
about:
Welcome to the world of Data Dave, the renowned data management divemaster and influential leader in data infrastructure, master data management, and data governance. With over a decade of expertise, Data Dave is not just a navigator but a transformative force in the data industry, guiding companies to unlock the full potential of their data assets.

Discover the insights of Dave through his bestselling book, "Crossing the Data Delta: Turning the Data You Have into the Information You Need," which showcases his profound knowledge and passion for leveraging data effectively. His commitment to educating and inspiring others continues with his hit podcast, "Talk Tech with Data Dave." This engaging series explores the latest trends in data, cloud computing, and technology, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable for both beginners and experts in the field.

Whether you're just starting out in data or looking to deepen your expertise, join Data Dave on this exciting journey to demystify the world of data and discover how it can be as captivating as it is crucial. Follow Dave for trailblazing insights and advice that light up the path to data mastery.
topSkills: Master Data Management • Scrum • Data Modeling • Amazon Web Services (AWS) • Podcasting

experience.description:
Over the past decade, Dave Wilkinson has been a thought leader in extracting knowledge from corporate data assets:

* guiding Fortune 500 clients to implement innovative architectures focused on generating knowledge from data, 
* leading teams at IBM and Initiate Systems in developing approaches for data lakes and other massively heterogeneous information environments to address client needs
* translating these approaches into product implementations for Data Integration, Master Data Management, and Data Governance. 

Central to Dave's approach to knowledge generation is a focus on desired outcomes. Contrary to conventional views of data management, this focus directs the investment in data and information management tooling to maximize the value of the outcomes based on the data available.  By applying pragmatic thinking and agile execution techniques, this approach enables valuable insights without massive effort and investment.

Dave brings a wealth of skills to the knowledge generation discipline: 
* Data Infrastructure
* Master Data Management
* Data Governance 
* Information Architectures
* Big Data, Hadoop
* Structured and Unstructured Data
* Integration

In addition, he has deep experience leading teams to deliver enterprise-class solutions. His development skills include:
* Agile/Lean Development
* 6 Sigma Black Belt
* Cloud-based and On-premise Delivery

Responsible for the Infosphere Integration and Data Management technologies including MDM, Big Data Integration, Cloud Integration and Replication.

Worldwide responsibility for strategy and development on this portfolio consisting of numerous acquisitions and in house developed software

Intimately involved in the data integration and data governance strategy and the big data integration strategy. Worked with numerous clients to deliver big data and data governance environments

Dave was responsible for the product integration of Initiate into IBM during the acquisition and went on to lead the strategy for the MDM product suite. In this capacity he was also responsible for the success and engagement with numerous clients to deliver the value of Master Data

publications.title: Crossing the Data Delta
publications.description:
Crossing the Data Delta is a new book from Entity Group that sets out an innovative analysis of the digital revolution.
It focuses on the gap between the enormous amount of data that organisations have, and the difficulties they face turning this into measurable business value. It applies whether your data is structured or unstructured, whether your organisation is large or small; whatever type of organisation you work for. Crossing the Data Delta presents an agile approach to driving digital value in your organisation. It provides a clarion call to treat data as an asset.
The valuation of a modern organisation depends upon the quality of its data. Turning accurate, complete, timely, secure data into business intelligence is how organisations will win the data wars of the 21st century. Crossing the Data Delta tells you exactly how to do that.

publications.title: e-Beam detection of over-etch in semiconductor processing and how over-etch level is related to defect detection parameters
publications.publishedAt: Society of Photo-Optical Instrumentation Engineers (SPIE) · Mar 1, 2021

publications.title: Using e-Beam inspection and overlay as tool for identifying process weaknesses in semiconductor processing
publications.publishedAt: Proc. SPIE. 11325, Metrology, Inspection, and Process Control for Microlithography XXXIV · Mar 1, 2020
publications.description: Shrinking design rule coupled with complex device geometries and introduction of new materials in the manufacturing of today’s semiconductor devices generate inherent device weak points which in turn give rise to mechanisms that result in yield impacting defects. The development and introduction of finFET has helped considerably in the quest to further shrink design rule. However, the design and complex manufacturing process involved in producing these high performance finFET devices bring with it a whole new class of defects that have considerable impact on device performance and yield. Some of these defects are buried beneath the wafer surface and are very difficult to detect. They are often missed by optical inspection, only to cause fails at final testing. Failure analysis (FA) then becomes the only means by which they are uncovered. FA is a destructive methodology and its benefits are realized only after the fact. Unlike FA, e-Beam inspection is non-destructive. e-Beam uses electron optics and has a unique ability to detect buried defects electrically by contrast (VC) between a defective structure and its reference. As process window gets tighter and tighter process margin becomes difficult to predict. In this work, e-Beam inspection and overlay data is used to identify process weakness regions on wafer to predict fails and help optimize process and improve yield.

headline: Chief Technology Officer
about:
David brings over 20 years of experience driving digital transformation and leveraging artificial intelligence to create competitive advantages. With a proven track record in startups and large enterprises, David is skilled in designing and implementing scalable technology solutions that enhance operational efficiency and improve customer experience. By building robust data architectures and fostering agile development practices, David has successfully led cross-functional teams to innovate and deliver technology that aligns with the company's strategic vision.

Before Consero, David held several technology leadership positions with Fortune 500 firms, including Charles Schwab, Dell Computer, and Wells Fargo. In those roles, he led overall technology strategy and direction, engineering and quality operations, and operational efficiencies and automation practices.

A recognized thought leader in AI-driven transformation, David champions data-driven decision-making and automation, helping organizations unlock new growth opportunities. His expertise spans machine learning, predictive analytics, and cloud computing, enabling the deployment of intelligent systems that adapt to rapidly changing market demands. David is dedicated to cultivating a forward-thinking, inclusive tech culture that empowers teams to experiment, learn, and adapt, ensuring the company remains at the forefront of technology advancements and industry standards.

headline: Growth Innovation & Change Leadership
about:
Experience in operations, services and sales at high growth enterprise software and services firms has helped me streamline processes and achieve goals. Innovative processes that leverage technology may be combined with proven approaches to lower operating costs most effectively.  I help teams penetrate new markets, flank competitors and solve business requirements thrust upon them by change in markets, technology or organizations. I've actively participated in the launch of a successful Wall Street IPO as VP of Sales and CEO of an AI software company including mergers and acquisitions, the sale of companies, and reorgs of public and private organizations. I have a leadership record with teams that enable change and innovation.

Certified in project management methods, financial analysis, HR, marketing, excel, planning and strategy as a former consultant that rolled out sales methodologies at Accenture, Deloitte, SAP and Oracle, I am a walking catalyst for doing the right thing and innovating - a change management leader, who was selected manager of the year in multiple companies, my goal is to continue to enable meaningful change and opportunity for individuals and organizations while being a humble servant to others. Deep dives for years in Manufacturing, Healthcare, Public Sector, Transportation, Energy, and Hospitality and have resulted in knowledge of how things used to be done and an insatiable desire to make improvements in a lasting way.  Organizational Development, Team Selling, Project Management, and Change Management are rooted in related concepts which I have taught thousands to apply in a repeatable manner.  Change is more than People, Process and Technology - its a culture and effects Policy and creates Pain - and the pain of change is less than the pain of stagnation - so every organization must embrace these concepts in a very concrete manner to excel.  That's what I enable with a team that is drafted, volunteers and selected from the ranks of the willing. I focus on driving revenue growth, lowering operating costs and developing those with potential, while hiring right and training well for skills that create industry leading revenue and profit returns. While I have held jobs in TX, GA, MA, NY and CA, I grew up along the border in South Texas and spend time in West Texas, and enjoy my family, the outdoors especially including fly fishing in the Rockies when time permits.

receivedRecommendations.givenAt: January 29, 2021, Nancy worked with Chetan but on different teams
receivedRecommendations.description:
Chetan is one of the most talented individuals I’ve ever worked with. He’s whip smart, creative, innovative, analytical, focused, competent, personable, humble, witty, thoughtful, and just a real pleasure to be around. 

In a deadline-driven environment, where co-worker interactions were mostly transactional, Chetan built an esprit de corps that naturally drew others to him. They sought his council as a subject matter expert on Medicaid rules engines, as a skilled software engineer, and as a general problem-solver.

For example, he identified and harnessed the talents of cross-functional teams across the organization to innovate an approach to address a complex client requirement. This is what a good leader does—identify people’s talents and maximizes them.

This was no easy task, yet he designed the architecture and developed a working prototype. He drove high-level executive meetings to convince client leadership to approve the budget to build a working solution based on Chetan’s prototype. 

He led a team of developers, QA folks, and Business Analysts to successfully drive and deliver this project. He designed the application in such a way that it could easily be extended to programs that would be added in the future. As a direct result of his product design, the business generated half a million in revenue over a period of 6 moths. 

In addition, he worked with me to develop a prototype for a training platform developed to house training and communication on complex ERP projects. He helped work out how to stand up the prototype and worked with me to convince leadership it was solution they should adopt. 

Chetan is someone you want on your team or even better, leading your team. He’s a true colleague in every sense. Given his collaborative spirit, his success will always be the teams’ success.

headline: Senior Software Engineer @ Amazon | Building AI Powered tools for IAM AWS
about:
I am a Senior Software Engineer at Amazon with a strong foundation in cloud-native application development, large-scale systems design, and identity and access management (IAM). My expertise spans a broad range of AWS services—such as ECS, Lambda, DynamoDB—and I draw on serverless architectures, microservices patterns, and AI-driven analytics to deliver secure, highly resilient, and data-informed solutions. Through hands-on leadership, I collaborate closely with a tech lead who has pioneered the integration of LLMs and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) into our workflows, enhancing our ability to detect usage patterns and streamline authentication at massive scale.

My technical skill set includes Java, Python,  React, TypeScript, Node.js, and Terraform, among other technologies. Beyond coding, I excel at bridging technical depth with business value, ensuring that IAM solutions not only meet Amazon’s stringent security requirements but also evolve in response to dynamic customer needs. My past experience at Fortune 50 enterprises—like The Home Depot and Ford Motor Company—has honed my ability to move quickly from concept to production, applying rigorous TDD, IaC principles, and DevOps best practices to continuously improve quality and speed of delivery. I am a lifelong learner, excited to explore new technologies and approaches that drive impactful, secure, and forward-looking engineering outcomes.
topSkills: Git • Amazon Web Services (AWS) • Java • React.js • JavaScript

Brand & Business Development | Investor Relations | Land Banking Strategy

I bring strategic insight and relationship-driven leadership to my role at East Avenue Investments, where I focus on expanding our investor network and advancing land banking opportunities across Texas and nationwide.

With a background spanning multinational corporations and entrepreneurial ventures, I operate at the intersection of investor relations, acquisition strategy, and deal development—helping clients invest confidently in one of the most foundational asset classes: land.

My passion lies in connecting vision with opportunity. I play a key role in shaping EAI’s brand and growth strategy by building long-term partnerships with investors, advisors, and stakeholders who believe in the power of real estate to grow wealth and transform communities.

After spending over 20 years in Dubai, UAE, I bring a global perspective and a deep appreciation for emerging U.S. growth markets—especially those turning overlooked land into thriving economic engines.

💡 Purpose-driven. Globally minded. Focused on impact.

about:
At Cerberus Global Dynamics, we're reshaping the cybersecurity landscape, and as the current VP of R&D, I play a pivotal role in steering architecture and infrastructure initiatives. My recent transition from IR Practice Manager to VP has allowed me to leverage my expertise in network and information security to fortify our systems against ever-evolving threats.

The organization benefits from my strategic approach to R&D, where I integrate cutting-edge cybersecurity practices with robust network security measures. This has enabled us to deliver solutions that not only protect our clients but also anticipate potential security challenges, ensuring their resilience in a dynamic digital world.

experience.description: Design, Architecture and Prototype new and innovative technologies
ThreatConnect is a Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP) that empowers large organizations to aggregate, analyze and act on their threat intelligence.

The Exabeam Security Intelligence Platform provides organizations of all sizes with comprehensive, end-to-end detection, analytics, and response capabilities from a single security management and operations platform. Exabeam provides elastic scalability through the use of a modern big data and machine learning architecture that ingests and analyzes data at any scale; all at a predictable cost. This means organizations no longer need to choose between adhering to security budgets and adding additional data sources that would minimize their security blind spots.

Bricata is a leading developer of innovative, high-throughput network security and data protection solutions. Our Bricata ProAccel Appliances are based on Next Generation Intrusion Prevention Systems (NGIPS) technology, enabling both small and large enterprises to secure and protect data and networks cost effectively, without sacrificing performance or creating bottlenecks that inhibit productivity.
Using our high-speed solutions to automate the capture, analysis and disposition of threats to network security at the core, Bricata offers more efficient threat protection across network and cloud-based devices. Built on the open source Suricata engine, and augmented with proprietary software and hardware to make it faster, more reliable and more user friendly, Bricata delivers double the throughput and detection performance in a single appliance at roughly half the cost of traditional IPS solutions. 
Now deployed across both the public and private sectors, Bricata’s security products are enabling its clients to do more with less, providing the means for customers to minimize the time, risk and expense of maintaining a reliable intrusion prevention infrastructure so that they can be more productive, competitive and compliant at a dramatically reduced cost.

publications.title: Threat Forecasting: Leveraging Big Data for Predictive Analysis
publications.description:
Drawing upon years of practical experience and using numerous examples and illustrative case studies, Threat Forecasting: Leveraging Big Data for Predictive Analysis discusses important topics, including the danger of using historic data as the basis for predicting future breaches, how to use security intelligence as a tool to develop threat forecasting techniques, and how to use threat data visualization techniques and threat simulation tools. Readers will gain valuable security insights into unstructured big data, along with tactics on how to use the data to their advantage to reduce risk.

* Presents case studies and actual data to demonstrate threat data visualization techniques and threat simulation tools
* Explores the usage of kill chain modeling to inform actionable security intelligence
* Demonstrates a methodology that can be used to create a full threat forecast analysis for enterprise networks of any size

headline: Chief Product & Technology Officer | AI Builder | Growth Leader
about:
I build what’s next—by pairing human ingenuity with AI leverage. Software development itself is being reinvented; leaders must re-imagine how humans and intelligent systems collaborate and organizations must rapidly transform to achieve and stay in leadership positions. Across ABBYY, OutSystems, Apttus, and momentiq.ai, I have transformed organizations by infusing AI into both what product is built and how it is built. I have acquired hands-on, intimate understanding of how to effectively use AI tools and systems in modern software development with a unique range of experience: from executive leader of 700+ engineers to a hands-on solopreneur developer shipping AI product. My servant-leadership style leverages this expertise to guide teams through disruption with empathy while instilling a metrics-driven, customer-obsessed culture in organizations.

Companies that fail to evolve will fade; those that adopt and adapt will thrive. My mission is to lead that (r)evolution—delivering AI-native products and platforms, transforming ways-of working, creating enduring customer value, and bringing meaning to innovative work.

Please reach out, let’s have a conversation.

headline: 🌐 100 Top Global Supply Chain Leader | Chief Procurement Officer | Vendor Management Expert | Tech Economist | Innovation Champion | IT Procurement Authority | Keynote Speaker & Industry Thought Leader | Girl Dad
about:
As a seasoned Global Procurement Leader with over two decades of experience, I bring expertise in strategic sourcing, vendor management, and procurement strategy in various industries, including energy, high-tech manufacturing, entertainment, healthcare, insurance, and financial services. 

Starting with a focus on IT strategic sourcing, my career trajectory has been characterized by continuous innovation, a robust reputation for creative and energizing approaches, and a commitment to risk management and risk management principles.

My tenure in the industry includes significant roles such as VP at Goldman Sachs, where I optimized global strategic sourcing and enhanced global vendor management capabilities, including increasing third-party minority business spend and leading policy and governance program development. 

At MetLife, I managed a $2.5B global supply chain. At Electronic Arts, I controlled a $200M service line P&L. These roles underlined my ability to handle large-scale financial responsibilities and drive substantial savings.

A key focus has been integrating empathetic leadership and personal integrity into my work ethic, fostering work cultures that promote team growth, accountability, and high morale. This approach has been instrumental in modernizing procurement processes, addressing challenges with outdated technology, and enhancing departmental efficiency and visibility. My efforts were recognized in 2021 when I was ranked 61st worldwide in Supply Chain Digital's list of top supply chain leaders.

I have contributed to leading industry publications and shared insights at prestigious forums such as the Annual Supply Chain Summit. My articles in Procurement Magazine and Supply Chain Digest reflect my commitment to sharing knowledge and best practices in the field.

In my procurement roles at Goldman Sachs, MetLife, Acxiom, and EA, I led initiatives like innovative, streamlined procurement onboarding, which significantly reduced onboarding cycle time and enhanced efficiency and spend transparency, achieving a 50% decrease in infrastructure acquisition times. My introduction of Spend Analytics and Strategic Procurement programs realized over $45M in savings over three years and my governance in software licensing cut ghost spend by more than $3M. 

These efforts demonstrate my agility in adapting to different corporate cultures and proficiency in navigating executive dynamics and implementing successful change management programs, always seeking to align initiatives with business goals.

headline: President / CEO EquipmentFX Ventures | Prospecting Systems | 90 Day Acceleration Programs | Sales, Marketing, Technology Roadmaps | Inspection & Liquidation Systems | Advanced Dealer Development Strategies
about:
I am driven to find better, faster, more efficient ways of doing things.  Turning hours, into minutes, into seconds is at the core of every project we take on.  Today, with cloud, mobile and AI solutions, there has never been a better time to improve solutions across the board for equipment businesses.

My first career included working for a leading CAT tractor dealership.  During this first 17 years, I worked in practically every role at the machinery division, the last 9 as VP / GM of our Hyster forklift division.  During this time, we achieved several areas of unique distinction:

* Highest market share for metro area dealership
* Hyster Company Dealer of Distinction
* First "digital dealership"; a study of our dealership called "what it's like when it's right"
* Happy employees and customers validated by annual surveys

My second career has consisted of 18 + years getting into the weeds of digital transformation strategy and implementation plans.  Many OEM's and dealers have dated legacy systems that limit productivity that results in too much time spent on managing activities that could otherwise be streamlined and made to be more efficient.  Some of my 165 + projects have consisted of:

* Free discovery calls and feedback, just to listen and offer help if needed
* Automation of systems for outreach, including email, phone prospecting and Linkedin
* A3 assessments, 90 day implementation plans, prospecting programs, fractional CMO work
* Product messaging, value proposition development, advanced digital dealer development services
* Platforms for buying &  selling equipment, inspection & pre-auction liquidation systems

I always love connecting with visionary leaders that know there is a better way and are curious about how to get there without spending a fortune or being a project guinea pig.  

Current Project(s): High Ticket Prospecting program for global OEM; REVOPS 360 program for leading edge financial services company.

Connect with me if you're curious about the FX projects and how we can help!

At CLM I managed all day to day operations which included sales, service, parts, rentals and strategic planning.  The economy crashed, so I followed my dream and passion.

During my tenure I successfully created and developed direct marketing collateral, formed partnerships with vendor groups and worked with a marketing co-op company to develop aftermarket sales initiatives to increase parts and service sales. This included developing and managing an 8 component direct marketing campaign.

I was directly responsible for leading process restructuring and changes that involved business system evaluation and training on a variety of sales processes, including quotations and an inventory management improvement program.  I led a company-wide leasing, rental fleet, warranty, ordering and procurement, customer service and reporting program. This project successfully addressed 45 specific areas of improvement.

Part of the role was to identify shortfalls in product management and marketing, as well as to develop blueprints and strategic business plans for all existing and new products.

This experience helped to develop and hone my avocation and ultimate goal of helping equipment dealers manage their sales and marketing processes more efficiently. EquipmentFX is here to serve as your Equipment Marketing Specialist and Strategic Advisor.

experience.position: Vice President; Change Agent for Equipment Dealer Sales and Operations
experience.description:
As Vice President/General Manager, I directed the operations of a CAT Tractor & Machinery Dealer while overseeing 220+ employees and delivering millions in annual revenue. I achieved the status of most profitable equipment dealership in North America year-over-year by growing sales and improving EBITDA. I managed daily operations, sales, marketing, vendor relations, and client relationships for high-value accounts with complete P&L responsibility.

Some key achievements in this role included:

• Instituted a culture of supportive leadership and creative team processes by coaching and mentoring staff and building a talented, self-sufficient team accountable for leading calculated risk directives.
• Developed industry's 1st truly digital marketing plan - website design and build, lead funnel creation, engineered sales processes, and implemented CRM system to close prospects and business leads.
• Penetrated new markets in Mexico that generated several million in new start-up sales and completed the buyout of an Arizona branch.

headline: Multiple Time Entrepreneur, 3x Fortune 100 CIO/COO, Robertson Stephens, Allstate, Aflac, Startup CEO, Board Member, Startup Advisor, VC, SXSW Stage Manager, PE Board Member, COO@Sempulse
about:
Mike began his career with Systematics, a cutting-edge banking software startup backed by Stephens Investments that eventually was acquired by FIS, the financial services software giant.  The financial models he wrote in 1982-83 are still running in their Bank Profitability Analysis System. 
After that, he worked at Merrill Lynch in New York, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and London over a 15-year span, where he worked extensively across Infrastructure Technology, Back Office, Capital Markets , Private Client Technology, and on due diligence and integrations of Merrill purchased M&A transactions.     Post Merrill Lynch, he worked at Robertson Stephens, the legendary Investment Bank, as Global Head of Infrastructure Technology and then CIO/COO. 
He then worked as CIO and Chief Operations Officer for Allstate Financial Services for eight years, where he led major digital transformation programs and  culminated in the end-to-end business process reengineering of the entire back office. 
He finished his corporate career as CIO at Aflac before becoming the CEO of AppBus, a Fintech Software startup in Philadelphia, taking them through two funding rounds over four years. 
He then joined Austin-based Ecliptic Capital as a Managing Partner investing in many deep science companies for its $65mm early-stage venture fund.   

He brings a wealth of experience to Sempulse, which he helped co-found nine years ago to help scale the company in his role as COO and Chief Business Development Officer. 

Mike is an advisor to multiple startups and has had two board roles in Private Equity transactions with successful exits. 

His goal is to devote the rest of his life to improving life on the planet, and Sempulse scratches that itch beautifully. 

He loves his family and grandson, who he and Monica (his wife of 37 years) are raising. 

Other than work, his passions are: Travel, Food, Technology, Science, Golf, and Music. He is working with a production company to develop a television series he created on International Cuisine and Travel.

I’m a software and AI consultant with over 30 years of experience in technology—primarily focused on software quality assurance, test automation, SaaS, and digital transformation. In recent years, I’ve expanded into AI consulting, helping entrepreneurs and small businesses leverage custom AI tools to streamline workflows, improve marketing, and grow smarter. As the founder of 24-7Press.com, I develop automation and content solutions that make AI both practical and profitable.

Alongside my tech work, I’m also a published health and wellness author. My Fat Burning Secrets series and coaching programs help adults—especially those over 50—take control of their health through science-backed fitness, mindset, and lifestyle strategies. Most recently, I authored The Last Human Advantage: Thriving in the Age of Intelligent Machines, a book that explores how to align human strengths with advancing AI to stay relevant and empowered.

Across everything I do, my mission is simple: solve real problems with smart systems—whether it’s code or the human body.

I’m open to new opportunities in software, QA leadership, AI strategy, or digital marketing where I can continue driving meaningful impact.

experience.position: Author: The Last Human Advantage: Thriving in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
experience.description:
In a world racing toward automation and artificial intelligence, what remains distinctly human?

The Last Human Advantage explores how to rise—not retreat—in the age of intelligent machines. With clarity and purpose, this book helps professionals, creators, and everyday thinkers reconnect with the timeless human traits that AI can't replicate: creativity, emotional depth, moral reasoning, and personal struggle.

Through real-world examples, personal stories, and thought-provoking insight, you'll learn how to:

Harness the power of purpose in a digital-first world

Reclaim emotional intelligence as a competitive advantage

Navigate ethical gray zones that AI simply can't understand

Strengthen your identity, creativity, and communication

Thrive by leaning into your humanity—not competing with machines

This book isn't about fearing the future—it's about owning it. If you're a leader, entrepreneur, educator, or lifelong learner, The Last Human Advantage will inspire you to lead with authenticity and courage in a world transformed by AI.

headline: Global Head of Manufacturing & Fabrication | Master Black Belt Lean Six Sigma
about:
It is my privilege to lead the Hanger Global Manufacturing and Fabrication network and the colleagues who all share the common purpose of empowering human potential together. Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for 2022, and rooted in 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger is a purpose-driven company with a vision to lead the orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) industry by providing outcomes-based care, clinical services, and value for our patients nationwide. 

In addition, I have over 35yrs of industry experience across several different companies, technologies and business units as a successful collaborative, empathetic and thought-provoking leader. As a Vice President of Global Transformation, I was responsible for creating and ensuring the execution of the global manufacturing and supply (GMS) strategy across digital transformation, sustainability, network optimization, segmentation and developing a high-performance organization. I was also responsible for global communications and marketing for the above strategies. 

Prior to that I lead the technology and supply platform for the Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (API), Medicated Feed Additive (MFA), Nutrition and Global Operational Excellence program for the industry # 1 and Fortune 500 animal health company Zoetis.  In this role, I had P&L responsibility for 9 manufacturing sites and 2 business units globally that served customers with needed supply and capability with ~ 1,000 colleagues and revenue support of $3.4Bn. In addition, I lead the successful start up and expansion of two API facilities to enhance supply reliability across the top products in the company. 

Prior to this role I was the Vice President of Global OpEx developing and driving the organizational capability in Lean Six Sigma across the enterprise where he delivered an average of $25MM cost savings each year for 8 consecutive budget cycles.

In an era of constant change, ambitious executives aspiring to become chief executive officers (CEOs) must turn uncertainty into a pathway for personal and organizational growth. To successfully ascend to a CEO role, executives must be adaptable, constantly acquire cutting-edge skills, revise strategies, and lead with foresight. Inspiring teams, making critical decisions, and developing strategic vision are integral components that facilitate resilience and growth.
The Chief Executive Officer Program from Columbia Business School Executive Education is tailored to these ambitious executives, equipping them with the frameworks and strategies needed to navigate the volatile business world effectively. Over 8 to 12 months, participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of strategy, leadership, and data and technology, enabling them to design a future-ready enterprise and positioning them for success in the highest C-suite role.

about:
My UX leadership spans high-impact roles at AWS, Walmart, and Finxact, where I have guided cross-functional teams of designers, engineers, and product managers to create innovative, customer-centric solutions in complex industries such as fintech, healthcare, and enterprise software.

At AWS, I led UX strategy and design in AI, enterprise, and SaaS, driving product innovation through scalable and intuitive experiences. At Walmart, I spearheaded the OmniQuest project, implementing a gamified system for Curbside Pickup that increased productivity by 17.5% in the first week, balancing business objectives, user engagement, and design excellence. At Finxact, I developed design strategies for intricate fintech workflows, leveraging Figma and InVision to deliver enterprise-grade solutions for payroll and financial systems.

Beyond these roles, I have collaborated with global organizations such as McKesson Pharmaceuticals, Lockheed Martin, Emirates, Bentley Motors, the Department of State, and the United Nations, delivering high-impact design solutions in fast-paced, regulated environments. My expertise spans end-to-end UX execution, including user research, design systems, stakeholder alignment, and product roadmapping—ensuring that every decision is rooted in data-driven insights and business strategy.

With my unique blend of UX leadership, product strategy, and hands-on execution, I am confident in my ability to drive scalable, customer-focused solutions that enhance user experiences and achieve measurable business success.

about:
I’m a passionate and results-driven executive leader with a unique skillset honed over decades of experience in corporate leadership, including C-suite and board leadership roles. 

My education and early experiences are in accounting and finance, and I have progressive experience in financial management, operations, and HR strategy. 

I’m a multilingual professional with extensive experience on three continents and a history of leading cross-country initiatives and acquisitions, scaling businesses for growth, and leading multicultural teams. 

I strengthen organizations through effective leadership, team development, and relationship building. I create clarity, communication, and consistency. And I value transparency, directness, and authenticity. 

KEY STRENGTHS:
•	Providing environments where individuals and teams can thrive. I am committed to inclusivity and empowerment, and I value collaboration.
•	Innovating and improving strategy through critical thinking and creative problem-solving. 
•	Implementing adjustments to accommodate new data and organizational climates.
•	Creating trust and removing cultural divides within global organizations; committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion initiatives.
•	Negotiating with key stakeholders including investment groups, silent partners, and bankers.
•	Expertise in social impact, sustainability, and ESG issues.

HIGHLIGHTED ACCOMPLISHMENTS:
•	Achieved average annual revenue growth of 25% YOY by leading cross-functional teams to accelerate organic growth, expand market share, and focus on the target market. 
•	Integrated numerous domestic and international acquisitions by defining and implementing operational integration plans
•	Created healthy collaborative teams, recruited from diverse backgrounds, and implemented operational practices to ensure internal equity.

Strategic Planning & Financial Management | Business Development | Mergers & Acquisitions | Strategic Data Analysis | International Expansion | HR Strategy | Leadership Development | Investor Relations | Negotiation | Process Improvement | Risk Management | Relationship Building | Creative Problem Solving | Data-based Decision Making | ESG | DEIA

headline: Built a store in the top 1% for conversion rate | eCommerce | Product Owner | Positive Leader | Mark 10:42-45
about:
I built a website in the top 1% for conversion rate, maintained 100% team retention throughout COVID and The Great Resignation, and have repeatedly grown store revenue in the face of an industry downturn. 

Need to grow a website and scale revenue? I'm your guy. 

--
About me:

I am a well rounded web professional with almost two decades of experience designing, developing, growing, and optimizing high performing websites using a blend of technical, strategic, data analysis, conversion optimization, and digital marketing skills. 

I am a servant leader who utilizes a collaborative leadership style paired with a self established philosophy labeled “obsessive positivity,” which generates multiplicative output from a team with high employee retention. Employs a solution oriented approach to project management, doing whatever is needed to conquer challenges. 

—

Key Accomplishments: 
• Built a top 1% for conversion rate eCommerce site in two years. Rebuilt the AMMD website from the ground up, achieving top tier performance through constant analysis, iteration, team collaboration, optimization, and A/B tests. 
• Maintained 100% team retention through COVID and The Great Resignation while growing from the smallest team in marketing/ops to the largest. 
• Repeatedly grew store revenue in the face of industry downturns.
• Designed, developed, and wrote all of the copy and marketing material for a personal project. Received one million pageviews within the first year and the second million pageviews within two months after that. Achieved an average of 8-10 pageviews per visit and a bounce rate of less than 10%.

--
Skills and Responsibilities 

Core Skills:
eCommerce, product management, revenue growth, customer funnel optimization, conversion rate optimization (CRO), A/B testing, web and sales data analysis and reporting, responsive website design, long term growth planning and strategy, competition research, traffic generation, marketing automation.

Technical Skills:
Shopify Plus, Liquid, WordPress, HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP, WCAG, GDPR/CCPA compliance, UI/UX, website automation, website personalization, Git, QA Testing.

Digital Marketing:
SEO, content marketing, catalog management, email marketing, social media, PPC, digital branding.

Servant Leadership:
Building roadmaps, ensuring stakeholder goals are met, team coordination and mentoring, vendor relationships.

headline: Sr Account Manager at LookOurWay
about:
LookOurWay leverages my extensive expertise in sales, marketing, and communications to deliver impactful solutions for clients. With over three years in my current role as Senior Account Manager, I focus on driving sales growth, aligning marketing strategies, and fostering strong client relationships. My ability to collaborate with teams and clients enables us to create tailored promotional campaigns that resonate with target audiences.  

Previously, I contributed to high-impact initiatives as Head of Sales and Business Development and Key Accounts Director, emphasizing collaboration with distributors and partners in sports and educational markets. Known for fairness and respect, my approach ensures trust and long-term partnerships. My dedication to innovation and client success remains at the core of my professional mission.
topSkills: Communication • Sales • Problem Solving • Leadership • Management

experience.position: Head of Sales and Business Development Director

experience.description:
As the Key Accounts Director for Pro Towels, the leader in the towel category for the promotional product industry, I work closely with distributors that are heavily involved in the sports markets, universities, smaller colleges and schools, all the way up to the big leagues. This is a very important market for Pro Towels, and we are constantly looking to partner with our distributors to help market to these sports teams and show them the value of our product line. If you need a rally towel for a game day giveaway, look no further than Pro Towels! If you need some T-shirts decorated for that game on Saturday night and your local decorator can't turn it fast enough, look no further than Superior Decorating. If you’re looking for some creative ways to market to some of these teams, give me a call -- I can help!

Responsibilities that come with my role at the company include, but aren’t limited to: developing and growing national accounts and distributor relationships; helping cultivate Pro Towels into programs and business for the future; growing our national account list; building a brand through our industry to reflect a company of integrity and quality, while having fun doing it.

With 24+ years in sales, customer service and operations, I can utilize my creativity and problem-solving on behalf of our clients. With my experience, I am excited to bring knowledge and innovative ideas with my heavy sports marketing background to help grow the Pro Towels Family to the next great level. I am known as a straight-shooter who treats her clientele as she’d like to be treated: with fairness, honesty and respect.

headline: Data driven marketing systems for B2B, SaaS & Healthcare | CEO @ Cosmo | Over $120M in Client Revenue in past 3.8 years
about:
Most businesses I talk to are stuck on one (or more) of these:

1. Disconnect between Sales & marketing
2. Not enough bandwidth to expand/implement new growth channels
3. No data-driven system to track or scale ROI

That’s where I come in.

I'm Junaid, an engineer turned growth marketer. I combine deep marketing execution with data & analytics (yes, dashboards are my happy place :)

Over the past 10+ years, I’ve worked with 100+ businesses – from early stage startups to Fortune 1000. Built data-driven marketing systems that are predictable and scalable.

A few of the wins we’ve engineered:
→ 67% drop in CPL within 3 weeks
→ 5x ROI on paid media for a niche B2B client
→ 700% revenue growth in a legacy business
→ Passive talent funnel built for a global enterprise

There’s no plug-and-play blueprint. Every growth problem needs a tailored fix.

If you're scaling, stuck, or just looking for an honest strategy plan for your business, check my premium section.

headline: Founder & CEO at Eden Data | Enterprise-Grade Cybersecurity & Compliance for Startups
about: Taylor Hersom is the Founder and CEO of Eden Data, the leading cybersecurity firm from SOC 2 to IPO. The Texas-native Deloitte-veteran has built Eden Data into a team of 50+ ex-Big 4 security advisors with 200+ clients including Zendesk and Kindbody. The firm is the back-to-back winner of Drata’s Partner-of-the-Year award and is on a mission to serve 1000 brands by 2025.

experience.description:
Eden Data's long-term vision is to create a future where companies can bring fantastic ideas to fruition using the internet while effortlessly maintaining appropriate data security and privacy. Eden Data focuses on the next generation of businesses that are ready to build security and privacy into their DNA, from their culture to their technologies to their entire operating processes. We are working to make information security (and inherently compliance) a core pillar of every organization we have the pleasure of working with. When we can help companies focus on their business instead of compliance, we are directly assisting those organizations to scale faster and make bigger impacts. 

Some of the things we can help with are:

- Data Protection & Governance Strategy
- Virtual CISO Services
- Virtual Compliance Officer Services
- Risk Management

- Responsible for the creation and management of all aspects of information security, privacy and regulatory compliance for RSI’s national cybersecurity client services program.  
- Built  internal security program into a competitive differentiator in the increasingly commoditized cybersecurity & compliance space. 
- Assured strategic and operational alignment with adequate governance for all stakeholders.
Increases value for customers through the increase in maturity and efficiency of Information Security processes
- Coordinated security risk identification and mitigation strategies, defensively and proactively, to ensure secure corporate and partner resources
- Mentored resources in relevant client departments to add value and effectiveness internally
- Provided regular updates to the board of directors as needed and coach client employees who are required to present security-related deliverables to the board
- Drove the strategic direction of the RSI Innovation Center in order to create proprietary, forward-thinking technology solutions that leverage the latest emerging trends.

	Consulted Life Sciences & Healthcare clients through the analysis of securities around financial systems.
	Engaged with the client to scope business problems, translates that into IT requirements and works with a team to implement solutions
	Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple assignments by prioritizing tasks and managing the results
	Embraced accountability and ambiguity in tasks and proactively applies problem solving skills to each engagement
	Communicated frequently with senior executives, maintaining client relationships with Fortune 500 companies. 
	Adapted to a wide variety of IT environments and creates a solution to each encountered problem 
	Specialized in IT audits and review services related to IT General Controls around financial audits
	Developed deliverables based upon the scopes of work as defined by management
	Created professional community service opportunities and lasting relationships with not-for-profit organizations
	Budgeted IT scoping objectives prior to projects in order to optimize efficiency and reduce costs
	Reinforced my value to the company through reliability, fervid work ethic, and a drive to constantly improve

	Implemented Epic EMR system at various Providence Health Services hospitals while maintaining HIPAA compliance
	Served as a primary liaison between business team, users, and technical personnel to assure that technical issues were resolved and client needs were met in real-time
	Developed and consulted a team of local doctors, physicians and nurses in order to successfully implement software within a hospital setting while working diligently to develop and implement strategic change
	Delivered exceptional customer service and became a liaison between clients and Providence Health Services
	Identified business problems with providers and created solutions with the Epic development team in real-time
	Educated providers and nurses to optimize their proficiency with the implemented system
	Created a lasting EMR solution to mitigate patient record errors and reduce costs

- Direct an organization with great leadership while maintaining a professional image, provide quality events, and offer tutoring sessions to students

- Consult with the Management Information Systems (MIS) faculty in order to maximize the benefits and success of the organization

- Conduct weekly meetings in order to present new ideas for fundraising, presentations, and future events for the current members

With a first focus on companies' most important asset, their people, OX’s mission is to elevate the workforce journey through quality, affordable housing and empowering digital solutions.

Built a U.S. + Mexico digital bank offering a suite of consumer banking, payments, insurance, and rewards services through a subscription-based mobile app, including no fee, real-time U.S. to Mexico remittances

Orchestrated initial launch, generating over 100k app downloads within three months

Grew team from 1 – 35 across engineering, product, marketing, operations, finance, and risk 

Established an all-in-one consumer money experience with depository, payments, insurance, and rewards partners in both countries

Launched a community forum called The Green to deliver money-focused content and conversation

Led deal prospecting, investment analysis, and portfolio company oversight with focus on control investments in U.S. banks with renowned bank investors Gerald Ford and Carl Webb ($1.8bn AUM)

Led strategic and tactical oversight of bank executive management, drove bank strategic planning, ultimately improving performance from below industry median to top decile (Forbes 2022)

Directed valuation and supported execution efforts in the sale of prime brokerage firm Merlin Securities to Wells Fargo

Progressed from analyst to lead examiner; evaluated 53 U.S. banks of varying size and complexity

Formulated formal corrective action plans for multiple troubled institutions as lead examiner

Evaluated and advocated for multiple banks to receive TARP funding as a relationship manager

Expedited regulatory approval for the merger of troubled affiliates during the 08-09 financial crisis
Analyzed U.S. state-chartered banks based on Safety & Soundness regulatory guidance

Operations Executive
